generation

Class Seg

  • java.lang.Object
    • generation.Seg

  • public class Seg
extends java.lang.Object
    A segment is a continuous sequence of walls in the maze. This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

      Constructor assigns parameter values to instance variables.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Seg

        public Seg(int psx,
           int psy,
           int pdx,
           int pdy,
           int distance,
           int cc)
        Constructor assigns parameter values to instance variables.
        Parameters:
        psx - x coordinate of starting position of segment
        psy - y coordinate of starting position of segment
        pdx - direction and length of segment in x coordinate
        pdy - direction and length of segment in y coordinate
        distance - of starting position of this segment to exit position of maze
        cc - used to decide which color is assigned to segment, apparently it asks for a color change when a segment is split into two

    • Method Detail

      • hasOppositeDirection

        public boolean hasOppositeDirection(Seg s)
        Tells if the given segment has essentially same direction but for its sign, so it is the opposite (or reversed).
        Parameters:
        s - given segment to compare
        Returns:
        true if given segment has same direction but reversed

      • hasSameDirection

        public boolean hasSameDirection(Seg s)
        Tells if the given segment has the exact same direction.
        Parameters:
        s - given segment to compare
        Returns:
        true if given segment has exact same direction

        public int getDistance()
        Returns:
        the distance

        public void storeSeg(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                     org.w3c.dom.Element mazeXML,
                     int number,
                     int i)
        stores fields into the given document with the help of MazeFileWriter.
        Parameters:
        doc - document to add data to
        mazeXML - element to add data to
        number - number for this element
        i - id for this element

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Equals method that checks if the other object matches in dimensions and content.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Inefficient default implementation of hashCode method. We override the equals method, so it is good practice to do this for the hashCode method as well.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        constant value so hashing works but all entities go to same bin

        Returns:
        the partition

        public void setPartition(boolean partition)
        Parameters:

      • updatePartitionIfBorderCase

        public void updatePartitionIfBorderCase(int width,
                                        int height)
        Sets partition bit to true for cases where the segment touches the border of the maze and has an extension of 0. Method is used in BSPBuilder.
        Parameters:
        width - width of maze * Constants.MAP_UNIT
        height - height of maze * Constants.MAP_UNIT

      • isSeen

        public boolean isSeen()
        Returns:
        the seen

      • getStartPositionY

        public int getStartPositionY()
        Returns:
        the y

      • getExtensionX

        public int getExtensionX()
        Returns:
        the value for length and direction (sign), horizontal

      • getExtensionY

        public int getExtensionY()
        Returns:
        the value for length and direction (sign), vertical

      • getEndPositionY

        public int getEndPositionY()
        A segment has to two ends and this method gives the y coordinate of a position next to one end. Use getY() to get the y coordinate of the starting position.
        Returns:
        the end position +1 in y direction

      • getEndPositionX

        public int getEndPositionX()
        A segment has to two ends and this method gives the x coordinate of a position next to one end. Use getX() to get the y coordinate of the starting position.
        Returns:
        the end position in x direction

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns:
        length of segment, returned value is >= 0

      • calculateGrade

        public int calculateGrade(java.util.ArrayList<Seg> sl)
        Method called in BSPBuilder.genNodes to determine the minimum of all such grades. The method does not update internal attributes and just calculates the returned value.
        Parameters:
        sl - vector of segments
        Returns:
        undocumented
